verses.text: 五旬節聖靈降臨五旬節到了，他們都聚集在一起。

words.note: A major Jewish festival, celebrated 50 days after Passover.

verses.text: 忽然有一陣好像強風吹過的響聲，從天而來，充滿了他們坐在裡面的整間屋子。
又有火燄般的舌頭顯現出來，分別落在他們各人身上。
他們都被聖靈充滿，就照著聖靈所賜給他們的口才，用別種語言說出話來。

words.note: Common in religious texts for divine giving.

verses.text: 那時住在耶路撒冷的，有從天下各國來的虔誠的猶太人。

words.note: Ancient concept of the world, often meaning 'everywhere'.
Describes deep religious devotion.

verses.text: 這聲音一響，許多人都聚了來，人人都聽見門徒講出聽眾各人本鄉的話，就莫名其妙。

words.note: Used in '一...就...' structure for 'as soon as...then...'
Resultative verb compound: 'listen' + 'perceive'
Idiom: 'unable to explain its wonder'

verses.text: 他們又驚訝、又驚奇，說：「你看，這些說話的，不都是加利利人嗎？

words.note: Used with another '又' to connect two parallel clauses or states.

verses.text: 我們各人怎麼聽見他們講我們從小所用的本鄉話呢？

words.note: Here implies 'since childhood'.
Used before a verb to form a nominalized clause, often indicating 'that which is done'.
Used at the end of a question, often rhetorical or asking for clarification.

verses.text: 我們帕提亞人、瑪代人、以攔人和住在美索不達米亞、猶太、加帕多家、本都、亞西亞、
弗呂家、旁非利亞、埃及，並靠近古利奈的利比亞一帶地方的人，客居羅馬的猶太人和歸信猶太教的人，

words.definition: to reside as a guest, sojourn

verses.text: 克里特人以及阿拉伯人，都聽見他們用我們的語言，講說 神的大作為。」

words.note: Often used in a formal or public speaking context.
Refers to the singular God, often capitalized in Christian texts.
Often refers to God's powerful actions.

verses.text: 眾人還在驚訝迷惘的時候，彼此說：「這是甚麼意思？」

words.note: Indicates ongoing action when followed by a verb/state.
Connects an adjective/clause to a noun, similar to 'which is'.

verses.text: 另有些人譏笑說：「他們是給新酒灌醉了。」

words.note: Indicates the agent in a passive construction.
Indicates completion or change of state.

verses.text: 彼得在五旬節的講道彼得和十一使徒站起來，他高聲對眾人說：「猶太人和所有住在耶路撒冷的人哪，你們應當明白這件事，也應該留心聽我的話。

words.note: Lit. 'five ten-day periods festival', referring to 50 days after Passover.
Refers to a formal religious discourse.
Acts 2:14 starts a new paragraph with Peter's sermon, this likely marks the start of the narrative.
Lit. 'sent disciple', referring to one sent on a mission.
Used at the end of a sentence to express exclamation or a rhetorical question.

verses.text: 這些人並不是照你們所想的喝醉了，現在不過是上午九點鐘罷了。

words.note: Used with negative adverbs (不, 沒) to emphasize denial.
Precedes a verb to form a nominal clause, e.g., 'what is thought'.
Completes the nominalized clause '所想', referring to 'that which you think'.
Indicates completion or change of state.
Indicates something is merely the case, or nothing more.

verses.text: 這正是約珥先知所說的：

words.note: Lit. 'one who knows first'
Often used with verbs to form a noun phrase.
Here, nominalizes the preceding phrase 'what the prophet Joel said'.

verses.text: 『 神說：在末後的日子，我要把我的靈澆灌所有的人，你們的兒女要說預言，你們的青年人要見異象，你們的老年人要作異夢。

words.note: The raised position indicates reverence for God.
Often translated as 'last days' in biblical context.
Used to bring the object before the verb, emphasizing the action on it.
In this context, refers to the Holy Spirit.
Used metaphorically for spiritual outpouring.
Lit. 'foretell speech'.
A supernatural vision or revelation.

words.definition: to have, to make, to do

words.note: A dream with prophetic or unusual significance.

verses.text: 在那些日子，我也要把我的靈澆灌我的僕人和使女，他們就要說預言。

words.note: Lit. 'female made/sent'.

verses.text: 我要在天上顯出奇事，在地上顯出神蹟，有血、有火、有煙霧；

words.note: Often refers to miraculous events.
Lit. 'divine trace'.

verses.text: 太陽將變為黑暗，月亮將變為血紅，在主偉大顯赫的日子臨到以前，這一切都要發生。

words.note: Refers to God or Jesus.
Often used to describe power or majesty.

verses.text: 那時，凡求告主名的，都必得救。』
「以色列人哪，請聽聽這幾句話：正如你們所知道的， 神已經藉著拿撒勒人耶穌在你們中間施行了大能、奇事、神蹟，向你們證明他是 神所立的。

words.note: Refers to the people of Israel.
Reduplication of verb for emphasis or casual tone.
The raised dot indicates reverence for God.
A person from Nazareth.
Lit. 'divine traces'.
The raised dot indicates reverence for God.

verses.text: 他照著 神的定旨和預知被交了出去，你們就藉不法之徒的手，把他釘死了。

words.note: The raised dot indicates reverence for God.
Lit. 'unlawful persons'.

verses.text: 神卻把死的痛苦解除，使他復活了，因為他不能被死亡拘禁。

words.note: The raised dot indicates reverence for God.

verses.text: 大衛指著他說：『我時常看見主在我面前，因他在我右邊，我必不會動搖。
為此我的心快樂，我的口舌歡呼，我的肉身也要安居在盼望中。

words.note: Lit. 'for this'
Refers to the physical body or human nature.
Expresses future intention or necessity.
Can also be a verb, 'to hope'.
Used as a suffix to indicate 'in' or 'among'.

verses.text: 因你必不把我的靈魂撇在陰間，也必不容你的聖者見朽壞。

words.note: Often used in formal or literary contexts.
Expresses strong certainty or necessity.
Used to bring the object before the verb.
The realm of the dead; Sheol or Hades.
Refers to Christ in this context.
Here means 'to experience' or 'undergo'.
Refers to physical decomposition or moral corruption.

verses.text: 你已經把生命之路指示了我，必使我在你面前有滿足的喜樂。』

words.note: Literary equivalent of '的', meaning 'of' or 'ʼs'.
Indicates completion of an action.
Can also be a verb, 'to satisfy'.

verses.text: 「弟兄們，關於祖先大衛的事，我不妨坦白告訴你們，他死了，葬了，直到今日他的墳墓還在我們這裡。

words.note: Lit. 'no harm in'.
A formal or literary way to say 'today'.

verses.text: 他是先知，既然知道 神向他起過誓，要從他的後裔中立一位，坐在他的寶座上，

words.note: The space or raised character is a respectful rendering of 'God'.
Indicates a past experience.
Used as a locative suffix.

verses.text: 又預先看見了這事，就講論基督的復活說：『他不會被撇在陰間，他的肉身也不見朽壞。』

words.note: More formal than 說 or 談論.
Refers to the realm of the dead.
Here, '不見' means 'not undergo/experience'.

verses.text: 這位耶穌， 神已經使他復活了，我們都是這事的見證人。

words.note: 位 is a respectful measure word for people.
The preceding space is a traditional reverence marker in Chinese Bibles.

verses.text: 他既然被高舉到 神的右邊，從父領受了所應許的聖靈，就把他澆灌下來，這就是你們所看見所聽見的。

words.note: The preceding space is a traditional reverence marker in Chinese Bibles.
Refers to God the Father.
Precedes a verb to form a nominalized phrase.
Directional complement, indicating action downwards.
Precedes a verb to form a nominalized phrase.
Precedes a verb to form a nominalized phrase.

verses.text: 大衛並沒有升到天上，他卻說：『主對我主說：你坐在我的右邊，

words.note: An emphatic negation.
Refers to the Divine Lord.
Refers to David's lord, the Messiah.

verses.text: 等我使你的仇敵作你的腳凳。』
因此，以色列全家應當確實知道，你們釘在十字架上的這位耶穌， 神已經立他為主為基督了。」

words.note: Lit. 'ten-character frame', referring to the cross shape.
Refers to Christ as Lord.

verses.text: 他們聽了以後，覺得扎心，就對彼得和其餘的使徒說：「弟兄們，我們應當作甚麼呢？」

words.note: An idiom expressing deep conviction or remorse.
Lit. 'sent disciple'.
A common address among believers.

verses.text: 彼得說：「你們應當悔改，並且每一個人都要奉耶穌基督的名受洗，使你們的罪得赦，就必領受聖靈，那白白的恩典。

words.note: To regret and change one's ways.

words.definition: in the name of, by order of
words.note: Formal usage, often in religious contexts.
Lit. 'receive washing'.
Biblical term for transgression.
A common biblical idiom meaning to receive pardon.
Often used for receiving spiritual gifts or teachings.
Reduplication emphasizes 'without cost' or 'undeserved'.
Divine favor or blessing.

verses.text: 這應許原是給你們和你們的兒女，以及所有在遠方的人，就是給凡是我們主 神召來歸他的人。」

words.note: A divine promise.
Refers to God as Lord.

verses.text: 彼得還用許多別的話，鄭重作證，並且勸勉他們，說：「你們應當救自己脫離這彎曲的世代！」

words.note: To provide evidence or testimony, often in a spiritual sense.

words.definition: to escape from, be separated from

words.note: In a biblical context, it means morally perverse or corrupt.
Refers to the people of a particular time period.

verses.text: 於是接受他話的人都受了洗，那一天門徒增加了約三千人。

words.note: Lit. 'received baptism'. '受洗' is a common verb-object compound.
Lit. 'door-disciple', referring to followers entering a school/teaching.

verses.text: 他們恆心遵守使徒的教訓，彼此相通、擘餅和祈禱。

words.note: Describes acting with a constant heart/mind.
Lit. 'sent disciple'.
Refers to spiritual communication and fellowship.
Refers to the communion ritual; '擘' is an archaic verb used for breaking bread.

verses.text: 信徒的團契生活使徒行了許多奇事神蹟，眾人就都懼怕。

words.note: Lit. 'faith disciple'.
Specifically denotes Christian fellowship or communion.
Often paired with 神蹟 (miracles) in biblical texts.
Lit. 'divine signs/traces'.
Often implies reverence and awe, not just terror.

verses.text: 所有信的人都在一起，凡物公用，

words.note: Describes the practice of having all things in common.

verses.text: 並且變賣產業和財物，按照各人的需要分給他們。
他們天天同心在殿裡恆切地聚集，一家一家地擘餅，存著歡樂和誠懇的心用飯，

words.note: Lit. 'same heart'
Describes continuous, earnest action.
Repetition emphasizes 'each and every'.
Refers to the breaking of bread, often for communion.

verses.text: 又讚美 神，並且得到全民的喜愛。主將得救的人，天天加給教會。

words.note: Grammatical particle, similar to '把' (bǎ).
Lit. 'teaching assembly'
